Note.Content: RSV NJB NRSV "they turn (to)" NIV "they do (not) turn (to) = [1g] | NJPS "they come back" ESV "they return" = [1cc]
MT HOTTP-B מֵעָנִי NJPS "(oppressing) the poor" | RSV NRSV "from iniquity" NIV "from sin" NJB "from evil" REB "(shuns) injustice" GNT CEV "(refuses to do) evil" = מעול
NJPS "they returned" = [1cc] | RSV ESV "had their seat" NIV NJB "lived" = [1yyy]
MT HOTTP-B NJPS "you shall come back" ESV "you must return" = [1cc] | RSV NRSV "they live" REB "they lived" = [1yyy]
The sense of the verb depends on the interpretation of its direct object: NJPS NRSV REB CEV "monument" | RSV ESV "power" NIV GNT "control"
MT-K וישׁבי RSV NIV NRSV NJB REB ESV "inhabitants" | MT-Q וַיָּשֻׁבוּ

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before
= causative action by which deities cause humans to face a direction different from the one they were facing before
= causative action by which humans cause a wheel to roll in a certain direction
literally: to cause (one's) anger to turn (towards someone); hence: = action by which humans express their anger in words or actions
literally: to cause (one's) spirit to turn (towards someone); hence: = action by which humans express their anger in words
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
literally: to turn (someone to someone else); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans to associate with deities, often to look for help and support
literally: to turn away (from someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities stop associating with other humans or deities
literally: (an event) turns away (from someone); hence: = process by which a certain condition comes to an end
literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = action by which deities cause a condition in which they are personally involved to come to an end
literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = causative action by which humans cause a certain condition in which they are not personally involved to come to an end
literally: to turn (back) to (an activity); hence: = action by which humans engage in an activity; in most cases this is an activity in which they were engaged before
literally: to turn (one's) hand (against someone); hence: = action by which deities take action against humans, usually involving acts of punishment

literally: to cause to turn back (to an activity); hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to engage in an activity; in most cases this is an activity in which they were engaged before
literally: to turn (one's) feet (to an activity); hence: = action by which humans engage in a certain activity
literally: to turn (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans or deities stop being engaged in a certain activity
literally: to cause (someone else) to turn (from an activity); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or deities to stop being engaged in a certain activity
literally: to turn (one's) face (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans stop being engaged in a certain activity
literally: to turn (one's) hand (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans keep themselves from engaging in a certain activity
literally: to turn (one's) feet (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans keep themselves from engaging in a certain activity
literally: to cause a letter to come back; hence: = causative action by which humans declare a letter that they have sent null and void, as if it has not been sent
literally: to turn the blade of (someone's) sword; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to fail in battle

Glosses.Gloss: to cause (someone) to fail in battle

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: = process by which something moves backwards
literally: to move back; hence: = process by which humans move backwards without turning around
literally: to cause (someone) to move back; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to stop advancing and move backwards instead
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which humans stop moving into a certain direction and start moving back into the direction they came from
literally: to turn; hence: = process by which objects move back into the direction they came from
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
literally: to turn; hence: = causative action by which animals, humans, deities cause (other) animals, humans, or objects to move back to a location where they have been before
literally: to turn (one's) face back towards (something); hence: = action by which humans decide to turn back and return to the place thy came from
exact meaning unsure; possible: = causative action by which humans in authority cause other humans move from place to place in a certain area
literally: to cause to turn; hence: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to pursue a wrong course of events
literally: to bring back (someone's) life from the pit; hence: = causative action by which deities brings humans back to life
literally: to bring (someone) back; hence: = causative action by which humans bring (other) humans back (from sheol)
literally: to come back; hence: = process by which an object is restored to its former condition
= process by which humans get the rest needed in order to be able to breathe evenly
literally: to cause to return to oneself; hence: = action by which humans regain control over something
literally: to cause to return (to someone); hence: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to regain control over something
literally: dust returns to the earth; hence: = process by which humans die and their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
literally: to return to the soil; hence: = process by which humans die and their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
literally: to return to dust; hence: = process by which humans die and their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
literally: to bring back until dust; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to die so that their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
literally: to bring back to dust; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to die so that their body decomposes and they become one with the earth
literally: to cause (someone) to return to death; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to die
= process by which an object changes into something else
literally: to come back; hence: = process by which a certain former relation is restored
literally: to come back; hence: = action by which humans reengage in an activity that they had been engaging in before
literally: to bring back; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities restore a certain former condition or relation
literally: to return (without having reached its goal); = process by which an event fails to reach its intended goal
literally: to come back; hence: = process by which a certain event happens once more
literally: to bring back; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause an event to take place that has happened before

literally: to send back (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities case (other) humans or deities to receive the appropriate return for their actions, which can be either good or bad
literally: to send back to (someone's) bosom; hence: = causative process by which deities cause humans to receive the appropriate return for their evil actions, which are mostly evil
literally: to come back on (someone's) head; hence: = process by which humans receive the appropriate return for their actions, which are mostly evil
literally: to send back on (someone's) head; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities case (other) humans to receive the appropriate return for their actions, which are mostly evil
literally: to return (to a former state); hence: = process by which an object is restored to its original state
literally: to bring back (something into its former state); hence: = causative action by which humans restore an object to its original state
literally: to bring (a matter) back to (one's) heart; hence: = action by which humans store information in their minds and continue to reflect on it
literally: to come back (to someone); hence: process by which humans regain possession of something that they used to have in possession before
literally: to bring back (to someone); hence: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to regain possession of something that they used to have in possession before
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans give other humans the equivalent for goods received or owed, either in monetary value or in kind
literally: to come back; = process by which a substance is reduced in quantity and therefore in volume
literally: to bring back vengeance; hence: = causative action by which deities find relief from their anger by inflicting punishment
literally: to bring back; hence: = causative actions by which deities or humans in a position of authority appoint (other) humans to a function that they used to have in the past
literally: to bring back; hence: = causative action by which deities restore the well-being of an indivual or group
= causative action by which deities restore the well-being of an indivual or group

Glosses.Gloss: to restore the fortunes (of a nation)

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to bring back (one's) self; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities restore a sense of well-being to (other) humans, which may extend from feeling refreshed after a good meal to feeling contented because of a major change in one's life situation
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans or deities respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation
literally: to bring back word; hence: = action by which humans respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation
literally: to bring back (one's) hand; hence: = action by which humans move their hand to the place where they held it before
literally: to bring back (one's) hand; hence: = action by which humans draw back their hand that had been streched out before
literally: to move (someone else's hand); hence: = causative action by which humans cause deities to draw back their hand that had been stretched out before

Glosses.Gloss: to cause (someone) to draw back (his) hand

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: literally: to turn (someone's) heart (in a certain direction); hence: = causative action by which humans heal a damaged or strained relationship between two parties
= state in which the boundary of an area changes direction and continues into a different direction
literally: to turn; hence: = process by which humans or deities change their mind about a certain matter, ► which usually results in a different course of action
literally: to turn away (someone else's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show their unwillingness to interact with (other) humans and honor their wishes
read {L:ישׁב<SDBH:ישׁב>}
